description: Variation of condition 6 pursuant to planning permission dated 23/09/2009 ref 2009/2520 (Variation of condition to allow use of forecourt on corner of Bedford Hill and Sistova Road for outside seating) to allow extension to hours of us between the hours of 08:00 and 23:00 hours.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - This development begun within 5 years from the date of the original planning application ref. 2000/1346.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990
Condition : 2 - Particulars and samples of the materials to be used on all external faces of the building. Condition no longer applicable. 
Condition : 3 - Details of plans and materials to be used for sound insulation between ground and first floors shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority and installed before the use hereby approved commences. Reason: To protect the amenities of neighbours. 
(Details submitted to and approved under reference: 2005/0095 dated 03.02.2005.)
Condition : 4 - The restaurant/bar shall not be open to the public other than between the hours of 08:00 and 23:30 and at no other time.
Reason: To protect the amenities of neighbours.
Condition : 5 - The work shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority. 
Reason: To ensure that the development is carried out in accordance with the approved plans.
Condition : 6 - The use of the forecourt at the corner of Bedford Hill and Sistova Road for outdoor seating shall only take place between the hours of 08:00 and 23:00 The number of tables and chairs shall be as approved under drawing number 5559_01 Rev A and must not be increased. 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council LP2 of the Wandsworth Local Plan.
Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
